info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 9:36PM EDT until August 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...SOUTHERN FAYETTE...MONONGALIA AND NORTHERN PRESTON COUNTIES... At 936 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Point Marion, or near Morgantown, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Westover, Kingwood, Star City, Farmington, Point Marion, Granville, Brookhaven, Cassville, Fairchance, Smithfield, Reedsville, Masontown, Bobtown, Tunnelton, Greensboro, Brandonville, Mount Morris, Bruceton Mills, and Valley Point. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
